```{r setup}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  collapse = TRUE,
  comment = "#>"
)
library(tidyverse)
library(devtools)
library(roxygen2)
library(PrecipPackage)

```

The precipPackage contains 5 functions 
Two summarizing data:
- Mean Precipitation by Season
-
Two measuring impacts:
- Predict Flooding Risk
-
One calculating costs of impacts
-

```{r example}

# Get precipitation data
data("monthly_precip")

# Mean Precipitation by Season Function
# To see how this function works you can change the year and use the same precipitation data
mean_precip_by_season(monthly_precip, 2014)

```

```{r}
# Predict Flooding Risk
# To see how this function works you can change the year and use the same precipitation data
predict_flooding(monthly_precip, 2007)
```

```{r}
# This function calculates annual precipitation totals for each water year by location. displayed as either a graph (TRUE) or a table (FALSE).
total_precip_by_year(monthly_precip, FALSE)

```




```{r}
# Calculate mean monthly precipitation using a multidimensional array
# This function calculates mean monthly annual precipitation for all water years, displayed as either a graph (TRUE) or a table (FALSE).
mean_precip_by_month(monthly_precip, TRUE)

```
